lead_paragraph: “It is our house that God created when we most needed it,” said one of the hundreds of villagers who fled into caves as Hurricane Matthew destroyed their homes.

headline.print_headline: After the Hurricane, ‘the Only Shelter We Have’
headline.main: Haitians, Battered by Hurricane, Huddle in Caves: ‘This Is the Only Shelter We Have’

snippet: “It is our house that God created when we most needed it,” said one of the hundreds of villagers who fled into caves as Hurricane Matthew destroyed their homes....
abstract: Many Haitians were forced to take refuge in caves carved into island's southwestern hillsides to weather impact of Hurricane Matthew; string of disasters that have hit Haiti have left many people vulnerable to storms, as many continue to live in tent cities; caves, which saved lives of hundreds during storm, continue to offer refuge for people who otherwise have nowhere else to go.
